meanings.definition: A sudden and intense emotional reaction, typically characterized by fear, anger, or panic.
meanings.sent1: Her freakout at the spider on the wall was quite dramatic.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise caused a freakout among the students in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: During the movie, his fake freakout over the popcorn spilling made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm outside triggered a massive freakout in the dog, who hid under the bed.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's freakout over losing her toy was heard throughout the house.

meanings.definition: To lose control of one's emotions or behavior in a sudden and intense manner.
meanings.sent1: She tends to freakout when things don't go as planned.
meanings.sent2: Don't freakout, everything will be okay in the end.
meanings.sent3: He would freakout every time he saw a bug in the house.
meanings.sent4: The news of the surprise party made her freakout with excitement.
meanings.sent5: Try not to freakout if you make a mistake, just stay calm and fix it.
